Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram

Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.
------------------------------
Employee: Zanele Nyoka
Report Date: 2020-10-20
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000 iu daily for 3 to 4 months. Then repeat level, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.
------------------------------

Report Date: 2020-10-20
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000 iu daily for 3 to 4 months. Then repeat level, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000 iu daily for 3 to 4 months. Then repeat level, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Employee: Zanele Nyoka
Report Date: 2020-10-20

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Nil
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.
------------------------------

Report Date: 2020-10-20

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Supplement with vitamin D3 5000 iu daily for 3 to 4 months. Then repeat level, aiming for a level of 50 to 80 ng/ml.

Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Age over 45

Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: Really good bloods apart from low vitamin D level
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.
------------------------------

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal Clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Employee: Zanele Nyoka

Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit your present & future self.
-Monitor your own risk factors.
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Low vitamin D level
Concerned about weight gain
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: -Screen often for the conditions that have occurred in your family. Employ lifestyle habits that benefit your present & future self.
-Monitor your own risk factors.
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Employee: Zanele Nyoka
Report Date: 2020-10-20
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Nil
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Employee: Zanele Nyoka
Report Date: 2020-10-20
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal Clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologists for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram
Overview Notes: Age over 45
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Men's Health Recommendations:

Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Low vitamin D level
Concerned about weight gain
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Employee: Zanele Nyoka
Report Date: 2020-10-20
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Normal Clinical examination on the day.
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Good blood pressure, marginally raised BP
Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Employee: Zanele Nyoka
Report Date: 2020-10-20
Doctor: Christie Pilossof
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation

Special Investigation Notes: 2+ blood in urine, has previously been investigated for it and nothing was found.

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.

Overview Notes: Very good mental health
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements

Men's Health Recommendations: 
Women's Health Recommendations: -Cancer screening is important, especially when you are taking hormone replacement. Please see your gynaecologist for a Pap smear & ultrasound and a radiologist for a mammogram.
Overview Notes: Your weight gain is most likely due to menopause and hormonal changes. Continue eating a well balanced healthy diet and consider increasing your exercise to 5 times a week and include muscle building/ resistance training. Consider reducing your alcohol consumption to a few times a week instead of daily.
